abstract.p: Grey Global Group chief executive, Jeff Alperin, is leaving advertising agency; units in New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco and Latin America are being reorganized (M)

block.p: Units of the Grey Global Group in New York are being reorganized.

Three executives are being named to new posts at the Western division of Grey Worldwide in Los Angeles and San Francisco. Jeff Alperin, the chief executive, is leaving to pursue a career in the financial sector, the agency said. Mr. Alperin, 46, who joined Grey in 1978, had been chief executive since January 1995.
Units of the Grey Global Group in New York are being reorganized.

Three executives are being named to new posts at the Western division of Grey Worldwide in Los Angeles and San Francisco. Jeff Alperin, the chief executive, is leaving to pursue a career in the financial sector, the agency said. Mr. Alperin, 46, who joined Grey in 1978, had been chief executive since January 1995.

In the Los Angeles office, John Crosson, 38, executive vice president and managing director, becomes president and chief operating officer, and Peter Mooney, 47, executive vice president and creative director, becomes president and chief creative officer. Kieran Hannon, 38, executive vice president and co-managing director at the San Francisco office, becomes president and chief operating officer there. No one will assume Mr. Alperin's duties as chief executive of the division.

In addition, the media employees at the two offices will become part of MediaCom, the worldwide media unit of Grey Global. Darlene Hayman, 45, and Alan May, 43, executive vice presidents at MediaCom, will head the Los Angeles and San Francisco operations, respectively.

Also, the Latin American regional operation of Grey Global is assuming responsibility for the agencies that create campaigns to reach Spanish-speaking consumers in the United States and Puerto Rico as FOVA in Los Angeles and New York and West Indies & Grey in San Juan are reorganized into a unit named the WING Latino Group.
WING will have 110 employees and billings estimated at $70 million from clients like Procter & Gamble. Jackie Bird, 47, president at West Indies & Grey, becomes president and chief executive at WING.
